alert.note: Alert for Brevard; Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 16 at 8:19PM EST until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Brevard, Orange and Osceola. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Palm Bay, Melbourne, Rockledge, Cocoa, Satellite Beach, Wedgefield, Malabar, Indialantic, Lone Cabbage Fish Camp, Sharpes, Merritt Island, Port Saint John, Camp Holly Fish Camp, Christmas, Avalon Park, Bithlo, Azalea Park, West Melbourne and Indian Harbour Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
